chapter.title: Report and Requisition
chapter.para:
Report and Requisitions are the core practice of any Pull Logistics system. In a pull supply chain, the movement of stock is driven by request and reporting submitted by the pulling logistics unit. In the E-LMIS, this logistics unit is the service delivery unit (the Health Facility).
The E-LMIS is designed to be configurable for different countries and different program implementations. To Acheive this, the E-LMIS has features to configure the report and requision form.

note.para: Report and Requsition is also known as "R&R"

chapter.para: To configure the R&R Template for a given program area, please go to Administration -> Configure -> R&R Template
From the screen that was displayed, please select a program that you would like to customize.

A program could be configured as a "pull logistics program" or a "push logistics" program. The fundamental difference between these two types of programs is that pull program functions by the Service Delivery Unit (SDUs) sending a reqeust and requisition form. On the other hand, in a push program, SDUs are expected to be fulfilled by the Warehouses based on Formula's such as demographics based estimate instead of the requests from the service Delivery Units.

note.para: Only "pull" programs are displayed in the E-LMIS R&R Template configuraiton page.

chapter.para: The R&R Template Configuration detail page allows you to decide which columns are applicable for a specific program. You can also use this page to decide on and arrange the order of the Report and Requisition columns.
